paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David the servant of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David the servant of the Lord.

paragraphs.content: The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart, that there is no fear of God before his eyes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart, that there is no fear of God before his eyes.

paragraphs.content: For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, until his iniquity be found to be hateful.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, until his iniquity be found to be hateful.

paragraphs.content: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit: he hath left off to be wise, and to do good.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit: he hath left off to be wise, and to do good.

paragraphs.content: He deviseth mischief upon his bed; he setteth himself in a way that is not good; he abhorreth not evil.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He deviseth mischief upon his bed; he setteth himself in a way that is not good; he abhorreth not evil.

paragraphs.content: Thy mercy, O LORD, is in the heavens; and thy faithfulness reacheth unto the clouds.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy mercy, O Lord, is in the heavens; and thy faithfulness reacheth unto the clouds.

paragraphs.content: Thy righteousness is like the great mountains; thy judgments are a great deep: O LORD, thou preservest man and beast.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy righteousness is like the great mountains; thy judgments are a great deep: O Lord, thou preservest man and beast.

paragraphs.content: How excellent is thy lovingkindness, O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.
paragraphs.contentHtml: How excellent is thy lovingkindness, O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.

paragraphs.content: They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house; and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house; and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures.

paragraphs.content: For with thee is the fountain of life: in thy light shall we see light.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For with thee is the fountain of life: in thy light shall we see light.

paragraphs.content: O continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee; and thy righteousness to the upright in heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee; and thy righteousness to the upright in heart.

paragraphs.content: Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked remove me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked remove me.

paragraphs.content: There are the workers of iniquity fallen: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There are the workers of iniquity fallen: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.
